questions.question: What is Ibn Arabi's concept of divine self-disclosure called?
questions.answer: Tajalli

questions.question: How many Names of Allah are traditionally recognized in Islamic tradition?
What is the Arabic term for the Most Beautiful Names of Allah?
questions.answer: Al-Asma al-Husna

questions.question: In Ibn Arabi's theory, what is the relationship between God's Essence and Attributes?
choices: Attributes are modes of expression of the Essence
The Essence is a collection of Attributes
Attributes are more fundamental than the Essence
questions.answer: Attributes are modes of expression of the Essence

questions.question: What is the term for the unknowable divine reality in Ibn Arabi's philosophy?
questions.answer: Dhat

questions.question: According to Ibn Arabi, what is the pinnacle of divine self-disclosure?
questions.answer: The Perfect Human (al-insan al-kamil)

questions.question: Which category of divine names includes Al-Rahman (The Compassionate)?
questions.answer: Names of Beauty (Jamal)

questions.question: What is the Islamic practice of remembrance through repetition of divine names?
questions.answer: Dhikr

questions.question: In Ibn Arabi's cosmology, what does each created thing reflect?
choices: Specific divine names to varying degrees
questions.answer: Specific divine names to varying degrees

questions.question: What is the term for the outward expression of divine attributes in the world?
questions.answer: Mazhar

questions.question: Which divine name is considered foundational to names like Al-Alim and Al-Qadir in Ibn Arabi's hierarchy?
questions.answer: Al-Hayy (The Ever-Living)

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of contemplating divine names in Islamic spirituality?
choices: To cultivate divine qualities within oneself
questions.answer: To cultivate divine qualities within oneself

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi's theory explain the diversity of existence?
choices: As a result of random chance
As an illusion to be overcome
As unique loci of divine manifestation
As a punishment for human sin
questions.answer: As unique loci of divine manifestation

questions.question: What is the Timorese animist concept that bears some similarity to the Islamic idea of divine attributes in nature?
questions.answer: Lulik

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the categories of divine names mentioned in the module?
questions.answer: Names of Wisdom (Hikma)

questions.question: According to Ibn Arabi, what is the role of the Perfect Human in relation to divine attributes?
choices: To manifest a single attribute perfectly
To actualize the full range of attributes in balance
questions.answer: To actualize the full range of attributes in balance

questions.question: What does the Islamic concept of divine names provide between God's essence and creation?
questions.answer: A bridge

questions.question: In Ibn Arabi's philosophy, how are the divine names related to each other?
choices: They exist in complex hierarchies and interrelationships
They are all equal and interchangeable
They are in constant conflict with each other
questions.answer: They exist in complex hierarchies and interrelationships

questions.question: What is the significance of the divine names being called 'Most Beautiful' (al-Husna)?
choices: They refer only to God's physical appearance
They represent the aesthetic perfection of calligraphy
They embody the highest qualities and perfections
They are meant to be used only in poetry
questions.answer: They embody the highest qualities and perfections

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi's theory of divine names relate to the concept of Unity of Being (Wahdat al-Wujud)?
choices: It contradicts the Unity of Being
It supports the idea that all existence is a manifestation of divine reality
It suggests that divine names are separate from divine being
It proposes that only divine names truly exist
questions.answer: It supports the idea that all existence is a manifestation of divine reality

questions.question: What is the primary difference between Islamic and Timorese animist views of divine qualities in nature?
choices: Islamic thought sees nature as devoid of spiritual qualities
Timorese animism rejects the idea of divine qualities
Islamic thought sees nature as a manifestation of divine attributes, while Timorese animism sees it imbued with spiritual forces
There are no significant differences between the two views
questions.answer: Islamic thought sees nature as a manifestation of divine attributes, while Timorese animism sees it imbued with spiritual forces

questions.question: According to the module, what is the relationship between divine names and human spiritual development?
choices: Divine names are irrelevant to human spirituality
Humans should avoid contemplating divine names
Contemplating and embodying divine names aids spiritual transformation
Divine names are only for scholarly study, not spiritual practice
questions.answer: Contemplating and embodying divine names aids spiritual transformation

questions.question: In Ibn Arabi's theory, what is the nature of the cosmos?
choices: A realm separate from divine influence
questions.answer: A theater of divine self-disclosure

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi's theory address the paradox of divine unity and multiplicity?
choices: By denying the existence of multiplicity
By seeing multiplicity as various aspects of a single divine reality
By rejecting the concept of divine unity
questions.answer: By seeing multiplicity as various aspects of a single divine reality

questions.question: What role do prophets and saints play in Ibn Arabi's concept of the Perfect Human?
choices: They are exempt from manifesting divine attributes
They exemplify the full actualization of divine attributes
They reject all divine attributes in favor of pure humanity
They manifest only a single divine attribute each
questions.answer: They exemplify the full actualization of divine attributes

questions.question: How does the concept of divine names influence Islamic ethics?
choices: It encourages believers to cultivate divine qualities
It discourages any attempt to emulate divine attributes
It has no significant impact on Islamic ethics
questions.answer: It encourages believers to cultivate divine qualities

questions.question: What is the significance of the name Al-Jami (The Gatherer) in relation to other divine names?
choices: It is considered the least important name
It represents the unity underlying all other names
It is used only in specific ritual contexts
It refers only to the Day of Judgment
questions.answer: It represents the unity underlying all other names

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi's theory of divine names relate to the concept of human free will?
choices: It negates the possibility of free will
It suggests that human will is an expression of divine will through specific attributes
It asserts that divine names have no bearing on human will
It proposes that only those who know all divine names have free will
questions.answer: It suggests that human will is an expression of divine will through specific attributes

questions.question: What is the purpose of visual representations of divine name relationships in the course activities?
choices: To create decorative art for mosques
To explore and express the interconnections between divine attributes
To challenge the Islamic prohibition of images
questions.answer: To explore and express the interconnections between divine attributes

questions.question: How does the module suggest comparing Islamic divine attributes with Timorese animist concepts?
choices: By proving the superiority of Islamic concepts
By finding exact equivalents in both traditions
By exploring similarities and differences in how divinity is understood
By rejecting any possibility of comparison
questions.answer: By exploring similarities and differences in how divinity is understood
